title: Multimodal CoT Reasoning

definitions.Error Analysis: The most prevalent error type is commonsense mistakes, accounting for 80% of the errors. These mistakes occur when the model is faced with questions that require commonsense knowledge, such as interpreting maps, counting objects in images, or utilizing the alphabet.

summary: The slide discusses 'Multimodal CoT Reasoning' and focuses on 'Error Analysis'. It explains that the most common errors in models are commonsense mistakes, which make up 80% of errors. These errors occur when models are asked questions requiring commonsense knowledge, such as interpreting maps, counting objects in images, or using the alphabet. A pie chart illustrates that 80% of errors are commonsense mistakes, 14% are logical, and 6% are others.
